p:
For the further identification of this morphology as possessing P432 symmetry, we try to check its known equivalent Wyckoff positions. Table 4 lists the first four Wyckoff positions along with their discretized coordinates and the local A block composition
ϕ A
(
r →
)
. As there is a satisfactory equivalence of
ϕ A
(
r →
)
for the first four position groups, it is considered that the given peculiar morphology belongs to the crystals of P432 symmetry.
